page.title: 01TROON Cornwall - Geography
page.content: TROON, the fastest growing village in Cornwall lies two and a half Km to the south of Camborne. It sits 170m above sea level on the slopes of Copper Hill which rises to just over 200m a further one Km south. {To the {east}lies the valley of the Red River, so called because of the colour of the water, due to mineral deposits in the soil. {To the west}the land slopes down to the richer farmland of the Pendarves estate beyond Treslothan, and{to the south west}to the estate of Hallegan Manor beyond Carwynnen. Beyond Copper Hill,{to the south,}the ground dips to Boswyn and another stream flowing north west through Baripper to meet the Red River near Gwithian. Finally{to the south east of TROON the land rises gently to the rough ground of Hangmans Barrow and Nine Maidens Downs.
